column4: can someone help me figure out how to implement the fix mentioned towards the bottom of this page? https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/istanbul/+bug/63996?comments=all
What post#?
#54 I think ...?
You'll have to download the source and the diff file, and patch the original file with the diff; then compile.
ok ... so should I remove the version i have currently installed?
Yes; you'll have to recompile a new version from source.
oh I see ...
I found the website for Istanbul ... there is a tar.bz2 download and the Ubuntu .deb downloads
You'll want the tar file.
ok I got it .. and extracted it ... do I just find that screencast.py file and copy paste the info in the fix?
Actually, I'm sorry, download the deb instead.
oh really?
Follow these instructions: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuPackagingGuide/BuildFromDebdiff?highlight=%28debdiff%29
ok
Follow the instructions, it says to "cd PACKAGE-* && patch -pl < ../DEBDIFF"
You need to change the PACKAGE with the name of the package and DEBDIFF with the .debdiff file
what is the debdiff? It says to download the debdiff ...
This file: http://launchpadlibrarian.net/36229421/istanbul_0.2.2-5ubuntu1.debdiff
ok thanks
so I paste that text into gedit and save it as .debdiff
Yup
That's great =). Patching is a pretty useful skill, I'm glad you managed to learn it yourself =D
hey thanks ... I completed that and now the application is working 100%
